Uses of Class
graph.SimpleVertex

  • Packages that use SimpleVertex 
    Package Description
    graph  

    • Uses of SimpleVertex in graph

      Methods in graph that return SimpleVertex 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      SimpleVertex SimpleVertex.clone()
      Returns a new SimpleVertex with the same name and ID as this vertex.
      Methods in graph with parameters of type SimpleVertex 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int SimpleGraph.addEdge(SimpleVertex source, SimpleVertex sink)
      Adds a new Edge to the graph, connecting source to sink.
      boolean SimpleGraph.addEdge(SimpleVertex v1, SimpleVertex v2, SimpleEdge e)
      Connects the two given vertices in the graph by adding an edge.
      boolean SimpleGraph.addVertex(SimpleVertex v)
      Adds the given vertex to the graph with no edges.
      boolean SimpleGraph.removeVertex(SimpleVertex v)
      Removes this vertices (And all of the edges going in and out of it) from the graph.
      Constructor parameters in graph with type arguments of type SimpleVertex 
      Constructor and Description
      SimpleGraph(Graph<SimpleVertex,SimpleEdge> g)
      Constructs a new SimpleGraph that is a copy of the given graph The two graphs contain the same elements but are completely independent in terms of underlying structure, so modifications to this Graph won't alter the returned graph, and modifications to the returned graph won't alter this graph.

      Moreover, the graph is deeply copied - the SimpleVertices and SimpleEdges in g are cloned before being added to this.
